properties.name: subject
properties.description: Empty object if certificate is self-signed else, it is filled with the issuer information of the certificate that is used for signing

properties.name: signedBy
properties.description: 1 (String) if the certificate is self-signed else, UUID of certificate which is used for signing

properties.name: signedBy
properties.description: 1 (Integer) if the certificate is self-signed else, UUID of certificate which is used for signing (String)

properties.name: certAlertDaysBeforeExpiry
properties.description: null if sendCertExpiryAlert is false, else specify number of days

properties.name: certAlertEmail
properties.description: null if sendCertExpiryAlert is false, else specify an email

properties.name: issuer
properties.description: Empty object if certificate is self-signed else, it is filled with the issuer information of the certificate that is used for signing

name: CoreAPI Connectivity_Certificates
description: API to access certificates, generate PEM keys and create/save certificates for the Certificates tool.
about:
Description

The CoreAPI Connectivity_Certificates API enables to access the certificated that are defined in the Proxy Authentication tool.

With this API, you can list all existing certificates within the system, fetch all information regarding a specific certificate, delete a certificate and, create/save certificates.

Prerequisites: In order for the API to work, you will have to change the endpoint in the General tab.

Operations  performed

Important note: Please review the definitions and the request/response bodies for each operation. In certain definitions, you will a description next each field. If not, view the example data in the selected operation.

/List

Get the list of available certificates. Within each object in the returned array, the UUID of each item is placed. This is the same value that /Get operation requires.

In the example data, you will find the response body of this operation.

Body
Definition
Request
None
Response
List


/Get

Retrieve the certificates details corresponding to the UUID.

In the example data, you will find the response body of this operation.

Body
Definition
Request
ID
Response
Get

/Delete​

Delete the certificates corresponding to the UUID.

Body
Definition
Request
ID
Response
Status

/Generate

Generate PEM keys.

Body
Definition
Request
Generate
Response
PEMKeys

/Save

This operation serves two purposes. It creates a new certificate and also edits existing certificates. The table below provides the request and response definitions for editing an existing certificate. In the Save definition, please refer to the description next to each key in order to properly utilize the method (view required keys/values, constraints, and formats).

Body
Definition
Request
Save
Response
Save

For creating a new certificate, the process differs from the one outlined above. To generate a new certificate, you must first generate PEM keys using the /Generate method. Afterwards, these keys need to be passed in the body below to create the certificate.

Request/Response body for creating a new certificate:

Body
Definition
Request
Create
Response
Save

Important note: In the Create definition, please refer to the description next to each key in order to properly utilize the method (view required keys/values, constraints, and formats).
